doc.after: The United States remained neutral at the outbreak of World War I in 1914 though by 1917 it joined the Allies helping to turn the tide against the Central Powers In 1919 President Woodrow Wilson took a leading diplomatic role at the Paris Peace Conference and advocated strongly for the U S to join the League of Nations However the Senate refused to approve this and did not ratify the Treaty of Versailles that established the League of Nations 112
